questions.question_text: Find the area of each of the following parallelograms: (a) (b) (c) (d) (e)
hints: Identify base and height from diagram

questions.question_text: Find the area of each of the following triangles: (a) (b) (c) (d)
hints: Use formula: Area = ½ × base × height

questions.question_text:
Find the missing values:
S.No. Base Height Area of the Parallelogram
a. 20 cm ______ 246 cm²
b. 15 cm ______ 154.5 cm²
c. ______ 8.4 cm 48.72 cm²
d. ______ 15.6 cm 16.38 cm²
hints: Rearrange to find missing value: height = Area/base, base = Area/height

questions.question_text:
Find the missing values:
Base Height Area of Triangle
15 cm ______ 87 cm²
______ 31.4 mm 1256 mm²
22 cm ______ 170.5 cm²
hints: Use formula: Area = ½ × base × height

questions.question_text: PQRS is a parallelogram (Fig 9.14). QM is the height from Q to SR and QN is the height from Q to PS. If SR = 12 cm and QM = 7.6 cm. Find: (a) the area of the parallelogram PQRS (b) QN, if PS = 8 cm
hints: For (a): Use SR as base, QM as height
For (b): Same area, use PS as base to find QN

questions.question_text: DL and BM are the heights on sides AB and AD respectively of parallelogram ABCD (Fig 9.15). If the area of the parallelogram is 1470 cm², AB = 35 cm and AD = 49 cm, find the length of BM and DL.
hints: Using AB as base: Area = AB × DL → find DL
Using AD as base: Area = AD × BM → find BM

questions.question_text: ∆ABC is right angled at A (Fig 9.16). AD is perpendicular to BC. If AB = 5 cm, BC = 13 cm and AC = 12 cm, Find the area of ∆ABC. Also find the length of AD.
hints: In right triangle, area = ½ × (leg1 × leg2) = ½ × AB × AC
AD is height to hypotenuse BC: Area = ½ × BC × AD

questions.question_text: ∆ABC is isosceles with AB = AC = 7.5 cm and BC = 9 cm (Fig 9.17). The height AD from A to BC, is 6 cm. Find the area of ∆ABC. What will be the height from C to AB i.e., CE?
hints: Area using base BC: ½ × BC × AD
Same area using base AB: ½ × AB × CE

questions.question_text: Find the circumference of the circles with the following radius: (Take π = 22/7) (a) 14 cm (b) 28 mm (c) 21 cm
hints: Convert mm to cm if needed for consistency

questions.question_text: Find the area of the following circles, given that: (a) radius = 14 mm (Take π = 22/7) (b) diameter = 49 m (c) radius = 5 cm
If the circumference of a circular sheet is 154 m, find its radius. Also find the area of the sheet. (Take π = 22/7)

A gardener wants to fence a circular garden of diameter 21m. Find the length of the rope he needs to purchase, if he makes 2 rounds of fence. Also find the cost of the rope, if it costs ₹4 per meter. (Take π = 22/7)
hints: Length for one round = circumference = πd
Cost = total length × rate per meter

questions.question_text: From a circular sheet of radius 4 cm, a circle of radius 3 cm is removed. Find the area of the remaining sheet. (Take π = 3.14)
Saima wants to put a lace on the edge of a circular table cover of diameter 1.5 m. Find the length of the lace required and also find its cost if one meter of the lace costs ₹15. (Take π = 3.14)
Find the perimeter of the adjoining figure, which is a semicircle including its diameter.
hints: Circumference = πd, so curved part = ½πd

questions.question_text: Find the cost of polishing a circular table-top of diameter 1.6 m, if the rate of polishing is ₹15/m². (Take π = 3.14)
hints: Area to polish = area of circle = πr²

questions.question_text: Shazli took a wire of length 44 cm and bent it into the shape of a circle. Find the radius of that circle. Also find its area. If the same wire is bent into the shape of a square, what will be the length of each of its sides? Which figure encloses more area, the circle or the square? (Take π = 22/7)
hints: Wire length = circumference = 2πr → solve for r
For square: perimeter = 44 cm → side = 11 cm, area = side²

questions.question_text: From a circular card sheet of radius 14 cm, two circles of radius 3.5 cm and a rectangle of length 3 cm and breadth 1cm are removed. (as shown in the adjoining figure). Find the area of the remaining sheet. (Take π = 22/7)
A circle of radius 2 cm is cut out from a square piece of an aluminium sheet of side 6 cm. What is the area of the left over aluminium sheet? (Take π = 3.14)
hints: Leftover area = square area - circle area

questions.question_text: The circumference of a circle is 31.4 cm. Find the radius and the area of the circle? (Take π = 3.14)
A circular flower bed is surrounded by a path 4 m wide. The diameter of the flower bed is 66 m. What is the area of this path? (π = 3.14)
hints: Area of path = area of larger circle - area of flower bed

questions.question_text: A circular flower garden has an area of 314 m². A sprinkler at the centre of the garden can cover an area that has a radius of 12 m. Will the sprinkler water the entire garden? (Take π = 3.14)
hints: Find radius of garden: area = πr² = 314 → solve for r
If garden radius ≤ 12 m, sprinkler covers entire garden

questions.question_text: Find the circumference of the inner and the outer circles, shown in the adjoining figure? (Take π = 3.14)
hints: Need radii from figure (not provided in text)

questions.question_text: How many times a wheel of radius 28 cm must rotate to go 352 m? (Take π = 22/7)
hints: Number of rotations = total distance / circumference

questions.question_text: The minute hand of a circular clock is 15 cm long. How far does the tip of the minute hand move in 1 hour. (Take π = 3.14)
hints: In 1 hour, minute hand completes full circle
